title: Vila Romana Font
content:
Please help identifying this font ![vila romana](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164358im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/40924.jpg)

 [‹ (x) specimen book font - various {gang}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164358/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5683 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Virgin Mobile Font - Ziggurat Italic {Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164358/http:/www.typophile.com/node/5687 "Go to next forum topic")
author: fermello78

comments.content: Hmmm... I think we can do better than that.

This is a image (for a better comparison) from [their](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164358/http:/www.vilaromana.com.br/) website:   
   
 ![vr](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164358im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41023.jpg)   
   
And [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20071218164358/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-stone-sans-2/stone-sans-itc-medium/testdrive.html?s=VILA%20ROMANA&p=36) is the MyFonts sample (smaller than the one I posted before).   
   
I still think it is Stone Sans; the V and the R were modified though, and there's some tracking.
The stroke widths seem different. But the M is very close.

I didn't post this sooner, but I agreed with Eduardo's ID as Stone Sans. I looked through about 1000 sans font samples using those letters, and that was the only font that was that close, in my opinion.
